intro: Saussurea klementzii, commonly known as the Klementzii yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely leafed stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Saussurea klementzii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
